ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Enough vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation in Brazilian Portuguese to hold a conversation! Practice with speaking, writing, listening, and reading in many different mediums. Knowledge of cultural elements of Rio, and Brazil in general.
I learned Portuguese and time management.
I didnt know any Portuguese before and now I have a strong foundation

I feel like I made real strides in my understanding of Portuguese language grammar constructions and basic vocabulary as well. The environment was supportive, and nightly practice kept my language skills sharper.
I certainly feel like this was the best language learning class Ive ever taken. I feel very comfortable speaking basic Portuguese.
I learned the basics of the Portuguese language.  I also learned about the different pronunciations and accents that can be applied to the Portuguese language.
How to speak Portuguese

I learned some basic vocabulary in portuguese, the different sounds, as well as some of the basic form tenses and conjugations. We practiced speaking daily and learned through various forms of media including written and oral portuguese.

Learned grammatical structure, words, phrases in Portuguese. Definitely came out of this course with the ability to hold decent conversations in Portuguese as well as understand media, literature, etc.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - almost everything! Bete is an excellent instructor and knows how to keep students engaged during 3-hour classes with a variety of different activities. Homeworks occasionally felt long, but it's true that the course is intensive and the work always felt useful. The classroom environment is very supportive. You are expected to make mistakes and then learn from them! Bete is also great at pacing the course so that there is flexibility and time built into the schedule while in Brazil to allow students to explore and take advantage. 
Weaknesses - a slightly more formal introduction of some grammar elements might have been helpful, but this is very minor

Strength-The size of the class was ideal.
Weakness-Homework was posted too late in the day.

The course is overall extremely strong, with great elements of interactivity. Language is best learned through not just a textbook, but also movies, music, games, and more. However, I would recommend including a spoken portion of the homework. Sometimes it felt like I knew what I wanted to say, but I had trouble practicing pronunciation on my own without guidance.
The class is extremely well structured and it was very clear what I was meant to learn from day to day.
I loved everything about this course.  The course was structured in such a way that allowed the greatest learning experience for students.
Course was very long, but Bete made it entertaining; homework was also long but helpful

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Without a doubt. I found Portuguese to be a really interesting language, and the course/my experiences in Rio have made me want to visit Brazil in the future and keep learning!
Yes, excellent opportunity to learn a new language and explore Brazil.
Yes, its a great way to get acquainted with Brazil and Portuguese

Of course! It is a phenomenal way to learn a new language if you're willing to fully commit yourself to the process. These first four weeks, mostly spent in New Haven, were definitely challenging for me. But toward the end, I felt prepared to begin learning even more Portuguese in Brazil.
I would highly recommend this course, especially for those are speak another Romance language!
Yes, of course, I would.  This course allows for a once-in-a-lifetime experience with a unique learning structure.
Yes, Brazil is fun

Absolutely, the professor is an amazing person that wants to see you learn, and being able to take this class without the stress of others really allowed me to learn the language properly and practice efficiently and effectively (while abroad!).

For sure! Learning Portuguese before coming to Brazil and then also learning while in Brazil was super helpful and conducive to this experience. Super well-organized to promote learning, as well as clear and helpful feedback. Also, there was use of a lot of different things to help learn Portuguese (songs, books, poems, etc).

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I will use Portuguese in my future career.
I will continue to study Portuguese and find opportunities to use it in daily life
I will definitely use my elementary Portuguese language skills for my upcoming trips to Brazil, specifically So Paulo.

I already served as a bona fide translator on my family's trip around Brazil! I am really looking forward to reading some Portuguese literature, maybe first in translation and then in the target language. I also want to study linguistic interactions between the Iberian Peninsula and Northern Africa, and Portuguese will be an invaluable tool in that research. I hope Portuguese will continue to be essential in my day to day interactions.
I intend on speaking Portuguese and continuing my language instruction for the rest of my life. I feel my base of language is so strong that I could very well speak fluently in a few years.

I will be continuing to learn Portuguese and will be returning to Brazil in some capacity.  I hope to use what Professor Jackson has taught me to become a better communicator with a greater stream of communications.

Having a base in Portuguese has opened the doors to return back to Brazil as well as explore places like Portugal and other Portuguese-speaking countries. It's also opened the doors to other cultures and experiences, making it really interesting and cool to check out things like different songs.
